frame.name: Renting_out
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Lessor</fen> who owns some <fen>Goods</fen> allows a <fen>Lessee</fen> to use the <fen>Goods</fen> temporarily in exchange for <fen>Money</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Lessor">I</fex> <t>rented</t> <fex name="Goods">my cabin</fex> <fex name="Lessee">to him</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Lessee
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Lessee</fen> has <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>Lee <t>rented</t> a textbook <fex name="Lessee">to Abby</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Goods</fen> is the item which is temporarily exchanged for <fen>Money</fen>. <ex>Kim <t>rented</t> <fex name="Goods">the shed</fex> out .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The means by which a commercial transaction occurs. <ex>Abby <t>rented</t> her room <fex name="Means">by putting an ad in the Examiner</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root>Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. <ex>The x-ray machine was <t>leased</t> <fex name="Money">for $12,000</fex> to a small firm in Menlo Park .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex> The hostel <t>rents</t> a bunk <fex name="Rate">for about 20 dollars a night</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Lessor
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Lessor</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and temporarily exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Lessee</fen>. <ex>So far, <fex name="Lessor">my company</fex> has <t>rented</t> the video more than three million times .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>Bob <t>rents</t> rooms <fex name="Unit">by the hour</fex>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the leasing takes place.
<ex>U-haul <t>rents</t> <fex name="Place">almost everywhere</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state-of-affairs from which the renting logically follows.
<ex>I <t>rented</t> it <t>out</t> <fex name="Explanation">because since Ned died, nobody's been using it for anything</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the renting takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the renting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Lessor</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>Stuart <fex name="Manner">reluctantly</fex> <t>rented</t> her his last apartment .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Lessor</fen> after the sale has occurred. <ex>I <t>leased</t> the whole lot <fex name="Result">at a loss</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Goods</fen> are (or have been) in the <fen>Lessee</fen>'s possession.
<ex>Our neighbors have <t>rented</t> their house out <fex name="Duration">for the last ten years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Imposed_purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Lessee</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>He <t>leased</t> the filing robot to me <fex name="Imposed_purpose">to organize all my legal documents</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Back
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates that the selling act reverses an earlier separate act in which the current <fen>Lessor</fen> rented or bought the <fen>Goods</fen> from the current <fen>Lessee</fen>.
<ex> There is a plan for Mercer to buy the ground and <t>lease</t> it <fex name="Back">back</fex> to the club</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relay
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates that the current leasing constitues a re-lease by the current <fen>Lessor</fen> of <fen>Goods</fen> that they bought or rented earlier from a third person (not the <fen>Lessee</fen> of the current leasing act).
<ex>My housemates <t>rented</t> my room <fex name="Relay">on</fex> to an English student .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rent.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: let someone use (something) in return for payment.
